intro: Brachyscome iberidifolia var. flore-albo, commonly known as the white everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, fluffy clusters of small white flowers. The plant produces ray florets that are typically white or pale pink, surrounded by a central disk of yellow flowers. It is a low-growing perennial with hairy, narrow leaves that are often gray-green in color. This species is well adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often found in sandy soils.
